solution.text:
Volume of original tube = \((\pi{r_ o}^2 \times h) - (\pi{r_ i}^2 \times h)\)
\(= _{{(22*((l*Decimal('0.5'))**2)*j)-(22*(((l*Decimal('0.5'))-k)**2)*j)}}_ cm^3\)
Now, Volume of new tube = Volume of original tube
Let the length of the new tube be x
Therefore,\(V_ {new} = (\pi{r_ o}^2 \times h) - (\pi{r_ i}^2 \times h) = (\pi (\frac {_{l}_}{2})^2 \times x) - (\pi (\frac {_{l}_}{2} - 7)^2 \times x)\)
\(\Rightarrow x = \frac {V_ {original}}{\pi (\frac {_{l}_}2)^2-\pi (\frac {_{l}_}2 - 7)^2}\)
= _{{trunc( ((22*((l*Decimal('0.5'))**2)*j)-(22*(((l*Decimal('0.5'))-k)**2)*j)) / (22*((l*Decimal('0.5')) + ((l*Decimal('0.5'))-7))), 2 )}}_cm

content.text: A metallic tube, _{{j*7}}_ cm long, has a thickness of _{k}_ cm and an outer diameter of _{l}_ cm. It is melted and made into another tube of thickness 7cm with the same outer diameter. No material is wasted. What is the length of the new tube?
